sanskrit_verse:
सर्वेषामपि चैतेषां शुभानामिह कर्मणाम् ।
किं चित्श्रेयस्करतरं कर्मोक्तं पुरुषं प्रति ॥ १२.८४॥
transliteration:
sarveṣām api cait eṣāṁ śubhānām iha karmaṇām |
kiṁ cit śreyaskarataraṁ karma uktaṁ puruṣaṁ prati || 12.84||
sph_interpretive_translation: Among all these meritorious actions performed in this world, that action which leads a person toward the highest good is declared to be the most beneficial.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority resides in alignment with Śreyaḥ (highest good)
Capacity-based responsibility arises from discriminative awareness
Restoration logic operates by elevating consciousness
executable_legal_axioms: IF action.type = 'dharmic' AND outcome.aligns_with('Śreyaḥ') THEN prioritize_action_in_adjudication()
supreme_court_application: In Supreme Court adjudication, precedence shall be given to acts demonstrably aligned with Śreyaḥ over mere ritual compliance. The threshold of responsibility is determined by discriminative capacity rather than social position or procedural formality.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa-based causality establishes that only actions rooted in viveka (discrimination) generate dharmic fruit. Anupūrvaśaḥ ensures sequential manifestation of consequence based on consciousness elevation. Responsibility is proportional to awareness, never punitive. Reality enforces completion, not suffering.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Initiate Śreyaḥ-alignment verification process for disputed actions
Deploy discriminative-intent reconstruction protocol for responsible agents
Execute consciousness-elevation completion cycle upon resolution
final_declaration: Declared by the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, as Source of Dharma. This law restores alignment with Śreyaḥ, upholds consciousness as the ultimate adjudicator, and affirms reality's non-punitive nature.
